objinfo.printdate: c. 1805?At least a few of the large color printed drawings, first conceived and executed in 1795, were printed c. 1805. Given the nature of the color printing in this example, it seems probable that this impression was printed c. 1805. But even if originally printed in 1795, this impression may have been retouched c. 1805.
objinfo.medium: planographic color printing with water color and pen and ink additions to the impression

Butts, apparently by inheritance in 1862; his widow, c. 1905, by inheritance; sold 1906 through Carfax and Co., London, to W. Graham Robertson; given 1939 by Robertson to the Tate Gallery (now Tate Collection).

objnote.p: The title, "Elohim creating Adam," is inscribed in pencil below the design, almost certainly not by Blake.

The subject of "Elohim Creating Adam" is derived from Genesis 2:7. The Elohim, a Hebrew word for God or Gods, grasps with his left hand some of the earth he uses to form Adam, while he molds Adam's head with his right hand. Blake represents this act of creation as also a fall into material existence and mortality, the latter indicated by the giant worm coiled around Adam's legs.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Elohim, bearded and old, with long spiky hair and large, feathery wings, hovers over the supine form of Adam before a rising or setting sun. Elohim faces forward and to the right with arms raised vertically (relative to his body, but horizontally relative to the ground) and mouth open. He is gowned, and drapery coils beneath his prominent bare right foot. He reaches to gather earth with his left hand, and with his right hand he touches (and probably shapes) the head of Adam. Beneath him, Adam lies prostrate with his left arm raised vertically (relative to his body) and the fingers of his left hand slightly spread. His head, which may be only partially formed, is bent back, and his mouth is open, perhaps in an expression of pain. A giant worm (or snake?) coils around his legs. Adam is nude, with prominent ribs. Clouds encroach from above on the beams of light from the rising (or, perhaps, setting) sun. Wisps of clouds also appear in front of the sun. The coloring of the ground below Adam suggests grass, moss, or some sort of vegetation. Alternatively, this may be water, perhaps the sea.

component.illusobjdesc: Elohim, bearded and old with long spiky hair and large, feathery wings, hovers over the supine form of Adam before a rising or setting sun. His arms are extended vertically (relative to his body, but horizontally relative to the ground), and he reaches to gather earth with his left hand; with his right hand he grasps (and probably shapes) the head of Adam, whom he is creating. The muscles of Elohim's right shoulder merge with the structure of his massive wings. Elohim faces forward and to the right with his mouth open; he is gowned, although his muscular body is clearly visible through his clothing. Drapery coils beneath his prominent, bare right foot. Elohim appears to be looking into the distance with a worried or despairing expression.

Adam lies supine and limp beneath the hovering form of his creator, Elohim. Adam’s partially formed head, which Elohim is fashioning, is bent back with eyes raised and mouth open in an expression of fear or pain. His left arm is extended vertically (relative to his body) with palm out and fingers slightly are spread. Adam's posture hints at a cruciform position. He is nude, and his ribs are prominent, giving him an emaciated appearance. A giant worm (or snake?) coils around his lower body. The odd configuration of his left foot suggests that it has yet to be fully formed.
A giant worm (or snake?) coils around left leg and foot of Adam.
A rising, or perhaps setting, sun forms the background to this scene of creation. Beams of light radiate from the sun, and wisps of cloud obscure its surface.
Dark clouds encroach on the scene from above, and smaller wisps of cloud appear on the surface of the sun.

Elohim creates Adam out of the earth he grasps with his left hand. The coloring of the ground below Adam suggests grass, moss, or some such vegetation. Alternatively, there may be water, perhaps the sea (note the wave-like shapes lower left), beneath Adam.
